intro: Triumfetta pilosa, commonly known as the hairy triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. The seeds are encased in a fluffy pappus, aiding in wind dispersal.
